c74object.name: the.circadian
c74object.digest: Provide a running timeline from the.jit.thalamus
c74object.description:
Written by Tim Heinze © 2020, www.xenorama.com.
Outputs frame-based or normalised timeline progression during realtime playback or offline rendering to support the approximation of a sequencer.
Connect this object to any parameter you wish to automate via mapping objects of choice, like scale, functon, mc.evolve, table, funbuff, etc.
If a fixed length is set in the.jit.thalamus, outputs frame count, normalised position (0.-1.) and boolean values for recording/rendering modes respectively, as well as the total frame count in the timeline.

objarg.name: render-context
objarg.digest: Specify a named render context to bind to.
objarg.description: For convenience, this can be identical to one's world render context name but is to be considered independent. the.jit.thalamus with a unique context name is required running in parallel for all members of the offline render family to sync and respond to.

attribute.name: name
attribute.digest: Specify a unique name as identifier
attribute.description: Specify a unique name to identify the object. the.circadian does not export any data or support import.

attribute.name: active
attribute.description:
Set the active flag. There are 4 active states available suitable for different purposes:
0 = bypass this object and mute output
1 = operate normally (default); output timeline information

method.name: bang
method.description: Sending a bang to the left inlet of the.circadian, will send all current timeline information out the respective outlets anew.

method.name: settings
method.description: Open the settings panel of the.jit.thalamus

method.name: thalamus
method.description: Open the main panel of the.jit.thalamus

method.name: frame
method.description: If a fixed length has been set or a recording has prevously taken place, the message frame with an integer index will output the corresponding frame and the normalised position from the leftmost outlet of all other the.circadian objects in the context.

method.name: position
method.description: If a fixed length has been set or a recording has prevously taken place, the message position with a normalised float value between 0. and 1. will output the corresponding frame of the normalised position from the leftmost of all other the.circadian objects in the context.

method.name: solo
method.description:
According to the numeric argument, will toggle the object's recording/rendering behaviour in relation to other objects in the context
0 = use current active flag if no other object is running @solo 1 or @solo 2, otherwise will set the object to active 0 (bypass)
1 = toggle active operation mode to 1 (operate) along with other objects @solo 1, but not if any object is running @solo 2, in which case it will be muted
2 = unique operation, operate only this object. This will set all other objects' active flag to 5 (mute)

method.name: unsolo
method.digest: Remove all solo states in sibling objects
method.description: The message unsolo does not remove the solo state of this object alone—as would the message solo 0—but does so for all other objects in the context as well.
